thanks. I gotta learn bash. I tried "find -name *.zip | xargs mv .", but that wasn't exactly correct :-)
it isn't correct for two reasons at least (maybe mine is not really correct either, mind you)
I get "foo.zip" is not a directory
first, you need to quote "*.zip", you can't just type it without quotation marks, because without quotation marks, it will be parsed by the *shell*, while you need *find* to parse it
second "mv ." after xargs would make xargs execute "mv . <filename>", while you want the other way round
as for it not being a directory - are you actually quoting *.zip?
